register.name: ATS1HR
register.gui_name: Address Translate Stage 1 Hyp mode Read
register.description: Performs stage 1 address translation as defined for PL2 and the Non-secure state, with permissions as if reading from the given virtual address.

register.name: ATS1HW
register.gui_name: Address Translate Stage 1 Hyp mode Write
register.description: Performs stage 1 address translation as defined for PL2 and the Non-secure state, with permissions as if writing to the given virtual address.

register.name: CNTHCTL
register.description: Controls the generation of an event stream from the physical counter, and access from Non-secure EL1 modes to the physical counter and the Non-secure EL1 physical timer.

bitField.name: EVNTI
bitField.description: Selects which bit (0 to 15) of the corresponding counter register (CNTPCT or CNTVCT) is the trigger for the event stream generated from that counter, when that stream is enabled.

bitField.name: EVNTDIR
bitField.description: Controls which transition of the counter register (CNTPCT or CNTVCT) trigger bit, defined by EVNTI, generates an event when the event stream is enabled:

bitField.name: EVNTEN
bitField.description: Enables the generation of an event stream from the corresponding counter:

bitField.name: PL1PCEN
bitField.description: Traps Non-secure PL0 and PL1 accesses to the physical timer registers to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: PL1PCTEN
bitField.description: Traps Non-secure PL0 and PL1 accesses to the physical counter register to Hyp mode.

register.name: CNTHP_CVAL
register.description: Holds the compare value for the Hyp mode physical timer.

register.name: CNTHP_TVAL
register.gui_name: Counter-timer Hyp Physical Timer TimerValue register
register.description: Holds the timer value for the Hyp mode physical timer.

register.name: CNTVOFF
register.description: Holds the 64-bit virtual offset.

register.name: HACR
register.description: Controls trapping to Hyp mode of IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED or IMPLEMENTATION SPECIFIC aspects of Non-secure EL1 or EL0 operation.

register.name: HACTLR
register.description: Controls IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED features of Hyp mode operation.

register.name: HACTLR2
register.description: Provides additional space to the HACTLR register to hold IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED trap functionality.

register.name: HADFSR
register.gui_name: Hyp Auxiliary Data Fault Status Register
register.description: Provides additional IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED syndrome information for Data Abort exceptions taken to Hyp mode.

register.name: HAIFSR
register.gui_name: Hyp Auxiliary Instruction Fault Status Register
register.description: Provides additional IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED syndrome information for Prefetch Abort exceptions taken to Hyp mode.

register.name: HAMAIR0
register.gui_name: Hyp Auxiliary Memory Attribute Indirection Register 0
register.description: Provides IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED memory attributes for the memory attribute encodings defined by HMAIR0. These IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED attributes can only provide additional qualifiers for the memory attribute encodings, and cannot change the memory attributes defined in HMAIR0.

register.name: HAMAIR1
register.gui_name: Hyp Auxiliary Memory Attribute Indirection Register 1
register.description: Provides IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED memory attributes for the memory attribute encodings defined by HMAIR1. These IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED attributes can only provide additional qualifiers for the memory attribute encodings, and cannot change the memory attributes defined in HMAIR1.

register.name: HCPTR
register.description: Controls trapping to Hyp mode of Non-secure access, at EL1 or lower, to Trace, Floating Point, and Advanced SIMD functionality. Also controls access from Hyp mode to this functionality.

bitField.name: TCPAC
bitField.description: Traps Non-secure PL1 accesses to the CPACR to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: TTA
bitField.description: Traps Non-secure CP14 register accesses to all implemented trace registers to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: TASE
bitField.description: Traps Non-secure execution of Advanced SIMD instructions when HCPTR.{TCP11, TCP10} are both 0, to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: TCP11
bitField.description: Trap accesses to coprocessor <n>, for coprocessors 10 and 11, which control the floating-point and Advanced SIMD features.

bitField.name: TCP10
bitField.description: Trap accesses to coprocessor <n>, for coprocessors 10 and 11, which control the floating-point and Advanced SIMD features.

register.name: HCR
register.description: Provides configuration controls for virtualization, including defining whether various Non-secure operations are trapped to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: TRVM
bitField.description: Trap Reads of Virtual Memory controls. When set to 1, traps Non-secure PL1 reads of the virtual memory control registers to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: HCD
bitField.description: Hypervisor Call instruction disable. Disables Non-secure state execution of HVC instructions.

bitField.name: TGE
bitField.description: Trap General Exceptions. If this bit is set to 1, and SCR.

bitField.name: TVM
bitField.description: Trap Virtual Memory controls. When set to 1, traps Non-secure PL1 writes to the virtual memory control registers to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: TTLB
bitField.description: Trap TLB maintenance instructions. When set to 1, any attempt at Non-secure PL1 to execute a TLBI instruction is trapped to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: TPU
bitField.description: Trap cache maintenance instructions to Point of Unification. When set to 1, Non-secure PL1 execution of cache maintenance instructions to the point of unification are trapped to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: TPC
bitField.description: Trap data or unified cache maintenance operations to Point of Coherency. When set to 1, Non-secure PL1 execution of data or unified cache maintenance instructions by address to the point of coherency are trapped to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: TSW
bitField.description: Trap data or unified cache maintenance operations by Set/Way. When set to 1, Non-secure PL1 execution of data or unified cache maintenance instructions by set/way are trapped to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: TAC
bitField.description: Trap Auxiliary Control Registers. Traps Non-secure PL1 accesses to the Auxiliary Control Registers to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: TIDCP
bitField.description: Trap Implementation Dependent functionality. When set to 1, causes accesses to the following instruction set space executed from Non-secure PL1 to be trapped to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: TSC
bitField.description: Trap SMC instructions. Traps Non-secure PL1 execution of SMC instructions to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: TWE
bitField.description: Traps Non-secure PL0 and PL1 execution of WFE instructions to Hyp mode:

bitField.name: TWI
bitField.description: Traps Non-secure PL0 and PL1 execution of WFI instructions to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: VA
bitField.description: Virtual Asynchronous Abort exception. When the AMO bit is set to 1, setting this bit to 1 generates a virtual Asynchronous Abort exception to the Guest OS, when the PE is executing in Non-secure state at EL0 or EL1.

bitField.name: VI
bitField.description: Virtual IRQ exception. When the IMO bit is set to 1, setting this bit to 1 generates a virtual IRQ exception to the Guest OS, when the PE is executing in Non-secure state at EL0 or EL1.

bitField.name: VF
bitField.description: Virtual FIQ exception. When the FMO bit is set to 1, setting this bit to 1 generates a virtual FIQ exception to the Guest OS, when the PE is executing in Non-secure state at EL0 or EL1.

bitField.name: AMO
bitField.description: Asynchronous Abort Mask Override. When this bit is set to 1, it overrides the effect of CPSR.A, and enables virtual exception signalling by the VA bit.

bitField.name: IMO
bitField.description: IRQ Mask Override. When this bit is set to 1, it overrides the effect of CPSR.I, and enables virtual exception signalling by the VI bit.

bitField.name: FMO
bitField.description: FIQ Mask Override. When this bit is set to 1, it overrides the effect of CPSR.F, and enables virtual exception signalling by the VF bit.

bitField.name: PTW
bitField.description: Protected Table Walk. In the Non-secure PL1&0 translation regime, a translation table access made as part of a stage 1 translation table walk is subject to a stage 2 translation. The combining of the memory type attributes from the two stages of translation means the access can be made to a type of Device memory.

bitField.name: SWIO
bitField.description: Set/Way Invalidation Override. Causes Non-secure EL1 execution of the data cache invalidate by set/way instructions to be treated as data cache clean and invalidate by set/way.

bitField.name: VM
bitField.description: Virtualization MMU enable for Non-secure EL1&0 stage 2 address translation.

register.name: HCR2
register.description: Provides additional configuration controls for virtualization.

bitField.name: ID
bitField.description: Stage 2 Instruction cache disable. When HCR.VM==1, this forces all stage 2 translations for instruction accesses to Normal memory to be Non-cacheable for the Non-secure PL1&0 translation regime.

bitField.name: CD
bitField.description: Stage 2 Data cache disable. When HCR.VM==1, this forces all stage 2 translations for data accesses and translation table walks to Normal memory to be Non-cacheable for the Non-secure PL1&0 translation regime.

register.name: HDCR
register.description: Controls the trapping to Hyp mode of Non-secure accesses, at EL1 or lower, to functions provided by the debug and trace architectures and the Performance Monitors extension.

bitField.name: TDRA
bitField.description: Trap Debug ROM Address register access. Traps Non-secure PL0 and PL1 CP14 accesses to the Debug ROM registers to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: TDOSA
bitField.description: Trap debug OS-related register access. Traps Non-secure PL1 CP14 accesses to the powerdown debug registers to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: TPM
bitField.description: Trap Performance Monitors accesses. Traps Non-secure PL0 and PL1 accesses to all Performance Monitors registers to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: TPMCR
bitField.description: Trap PMCR accesses. Traps Non-secure PL0 and PL1 accesses to the PMCR to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: HPMN
bitField.description: Defines the number of Performance Monitors counters that are accessible from Non-secure EL1 modes, and from Non-secure EL0 modes if unprivileged access is enabled.

register.name: HDFAR
register.description: Holds the virtual address of the faulting address that caused a synchronous Data Abort exception that is taken to Hyp mode.

register.name: HIFAR
register.description: Holds the virtual address of the faulting address that caused a synchronous Prefetch Abort exception that is taken to Hyp mode.

register.name: HMAIR0
register.description: Along with HMAIR1, provides the memory attribute encodings corresponding to the possible AttrIndx values in a Long-descriptor format translation table entry for stage 1 translations for memory accesses from Hyp mode.

bitField.name: Attr3
bitField.description: The memory attribute encoding for an AttrIndx[2:0] entry in a Long descriptor format translation table entry, where:

bitField.name: Attr2
bitField.description: The memory attribute encoding for an AttrIndx[2:0] entry in a Long descriptor format translation table entry, where:

bitField.name: Attr1
bitField.description: The memory attribute encoding for an AttrIndx[2:0] entry in a Long descriptor format translation table entry, where:

bitField.name: Attr0
bitField.description: The memory attribute encoding for an AttrIndx[2:0] entry in a Long descriptor format translation table entry, where:

register.name: HMAIR1
register.description: Along with HMAIR0, provides the memory attribute encodings corresponding to the possible AttrIndx values in a Long-descriptor format translation table entry for stage 1 translations for memory accesses from Hyp mode.

bitField.name: Attr7
bitField.description: The memory attribute encoding for an AttrIndx[2:0] entry in a Long descriptor format translation table entry, where:

bitField.name: Attr6
bitField.description: The memory attribute encoding for an AttrIndx[2:0] entry in a Long descriptor format translation table entry, where:

bitField.name: Attr5
bitField.description: The memory attribute encoding for an AttrIndx[2:0] entry in a Long descriptor format translation table entry, where:

bitField.name: Attr4
bitField.description: The memory attribute encoding for an AttrIndx[2:0] entry in a Long descriptor format translation table entry, where:

register.name: HPFAR
register.description: Holds the faulting IPA for some aborts on a stage 2 translation taken to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: FIPA_39_12
bitField.description: Bits [39:12] of the faulting intermediate physical address.

register.name: HRMR
register.description: If EL2 is the highest implemented Exception level:

bitField.name: RR
bitField.description: Setting this bit to 1 requests a Warm reset.

bitField.name: AA64
bitField.description: When EL2 can use AArch32, determines which Execution state the PE boots into after a Warm reset:

register.name: HSCTLR
register.description: Provides top level control of the system operation in Hyp mode. This register provides Hyp mode control of features controlled by the Banked SCTLR bits, and shows the values of the non-Banked SCTLR bits.

bitField.name: EE
bitField.description: The value of the PSTATE.E bit on entry to Hyp mode, the endianness of stage 1 translation table walks in the PL2 translation regime, and the endianness of stage 2 translation table walks in the PL1&0 translation regime.

bitField.name: WXN
bitField.description: Write permission implies XN (Execute Never). This bit can be used to require all memory regions with write permission to be treated as XN for the EL2 translation regime.

bitField.name: SED
bitField.description: SETEND instruction disable. Disables SETEND instructions at PL2.

bitField.name: ITD
bitField.description: IT Disable. Disables some uses of IT instructions at PL2.

bitField.name: CP15BEN
bitField.description: CP15 barrier operation instruction enable. Enables accesses to the CP15 DMB, DSB, and ISB barrier operations from PL2.

bitField.name: M
bitField.description: MMU enable for EL2 stage 1 address translation.

register.name: HSR
register.description: Holds syndrome information for an exception taken to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: EC
bitField.description: Exception Class. Indicates the reason for the exception that this register holds information about.

bitField.name: IL
bitField.description: Instruction length bit. Indicates the size of the instruction that has been trapped to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: ISS
bitField.description: Instruction Specific Syndrome. Architecturally, this field can be defined independently for each defined Exception class. However, in practice, some ISS encodings are used for more than one Exception class.

register.name: HSTR
register.description: Controls trapping to Hyp mode of Non-secure accesses, at EL1 or lower, to the CP15 primary coprocessor registers, {c0-c3,c5-c13,c15} using MCR, MRC, MCRR, and MRRC instructions.

bitField.name: T15
bitField.description: HSTR.{T0-T3, T5-T13, T15} trap Non-secure PL0 and PL1 accesses, using MCR, MRC, MCRR, and MRRC instructions, to the CP15 System registers, by the accessed primary CP15 register number, {c0-c3, c5-c13, c15}.

bitField.name: T14
bitField.description: HSTR.{T0-T3, T5-T13, T15} trap Non-secure PL0 and PL1 accesses, using MCR, MRC, MCRR, and MRRC instructions, to the CP15 System registers, by the accessed primary CP15 register number, {c0-c3, c5-c13, c15}.

bitField.name: T13
bitField.description: HSTR.{T0-T3, T5-T13, T15} trap Non-secure PL0 and PL1 accesses, using MCR, MRC, MCRR, and MRRC instructions, to the CP15 System registers, by the accessed primary CP15 register number, {c0-c3, c5-c13, c15}.

bitField.name: T12
bitField.description: HSTR.{T0-T3, T5-T13, T15} trap Non-secure PL0 and PL1 accesses, using MCR, MRC, MCRR, and MRRC instructions, to the CP15 System registers, by the accessed primary CP15 register number, {c0-c3, c5-c13, c15}.

bitField.name: T11
bitField.description: HSTR.{T0-T3, T5-T13, T15} trap Non-secure PL0 and PL1 accesses, using MCR, MRC, MCRR, and MRRC instructions, to the CP15 System registers, by the accessed primary CP15 register number, {c0-c3, c5-c13, c15}.

bitField.name: T10
bitField.description: HSTR.{T0-T3, T5-T13, T15} trap Non-secure PL0 and PL1 accesses, using MCR, MRC, MCRR, and MRRC instructions, to the CP15 System registers, by the accessed primary CP15 register number, {c0-c3, c5-c13, c15}.

bitField.name: T9
bitField.description: HSTR.{T0-T3, T5-T13, T15} trap Non-secure PL0 and PL1 accesses, using MCR, MRC, MCRR, and MRRC instructions, to the CP15 System registers, by the accessed primary CP15 register number, {c0-c3, c5-c13, c15}.

bitField.name: T8
bitField.description: HSTR.{T0-T3, T5-T13, T15} trap Non-secure PL0 and PL1 accesses, using MCR, MRC, MCRR, and MRRC instructions, to the CP15 System registers, by the accessed primary CP15 register number, {c0-c3, c5-c13, c15}.

bitField.name: T7
bitField.description: HSTR.{T0-T3, T5-T13, T15} trap Non-secure PL0 and PL1 accesses, using MCR, MRC, MCRR, and MRRC instructions, to the CP15 System registers, by the accessed primary CP15 register number, {c0-c3, c5-c13, c15}.

bitField.name: T6
bitField.description: HSTR.{T0-T3, T5-T13, T15} trap Non-secure PL0 and PL1 accesses, using MCR, MRC, MCRR, and MRRC instructions, to the CP15 System registers, by the accessed primary CP15 register number, {c0-c3, c5-c13, c15}.

bitField.name: T5
bitField.description: HSTR.{T0-T3, T5-T13, T15} trap Non-secure PL0 and PL1 accesses, using MCR, MRC, MCRR, and MRRC instructions, to the CP15 System registers, by the accessed primary CP15 register number, {c0-c3, c5-c13, c15}.

bitField.name: T4
bitField.description: HSTR.{T0-T3, T5-T13, T15} trap Non-secure PL0 and PL1 accesses, using MCR, MRC, MCRR, and MRRC instructions, to the CP15 System registers, by the accessed primary CP15 register number, {c0-c3, c5-c13, c15}.

bitField.name: T3
bitField.description: HSTR.{T0-T3, T5-T13, T15} trap Non-secure PL0 and PL1 accesses, using MCR, MRC, MCRR, and MRRC instructions, to the CP15 System registers, by the accessed primary CP15 register number, {c0-c3, c5-c13, c15}.

bitField.name: T2
bitField.description: HSTR.{T0-T3, T5-T13, T15} trap Non-secure PL0 and PL1 accesses, using MCR, MRC, MCRR, and MRRC instructions, to the CP15 System registers, by the accessed primary CP15 register number, {c0-c3, c5-c13, c15}.

bitField.name: T1
bitField.description: HSTR.{T0-T3, T5-T13, T15} trap Non-secure PL0 and PL1 accesses, using MCR, MRC, MCRR, and MRRC instructions, to the CP15 System registers, by the accessed primary CP15 register number, {c0-c3, c5-c13, c15}.

bitField.name: T0
bitField.description: HSTR.{T0-T3, T5-T13, T15} trap Non-secure PL0 and PL1 accesses, using MCR, MRC, MCRR, and MRRC instructions, to the CP15 System registers, by the accessed primary CP15 register number, {c0-c3, c5-c13, c15}.

register.name: HTCR
register.description: Controls translation table walks required for the stage 1 translation of memory accesses from Hyp mode, and holds cacheability and shareability information for the accesses.

bitField.name: SH0
bitField.description: Shareability attribute for memory associated with translation table walks using HTTBR.

bitField.name: ORGN0
bitField.description: Outer cacheability attribute for memory associated with translation table walks using HTTBR.

bitField.name: IRGN0
bitField.description: Inner cacheability attribute for memory associated with translation table walks using HTTBR.

bitField.name: T0SZ
bitField.description: The size offset of the memory region addressed by HTTBR. The region size is 2^(32-T0SZ) bytes.

register.name: HTPIDR
register.description: Provides a location where software running in Hyp mode can store thread identifying information that is not visible to Non-secure software executing at EL0 or EL1, for hypervisor management purposes.

register.name: HTTBR
register.description: Holds the base address of the translation table for the stage 1 translation of memory accesses from Hyp mode.

bitField.name: BADDR
bitField.description: Translation table base address, bits[47:x], Bits [x-1:0] are RES0, with the additional requirement that if bits[x-1:3] are not all zero, this is a misaligned Translation Table Base Address, with effects that are CONSTRAINED UNPREDICTABLE, and must be one of the following:

register.name: HVBAR
register.description: Holds the vector base address for any exception that is taken to Hyp mode.

register.name: ICC_HSRE
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Hyp System Register Enable register
register.description: Controls whether the System register interface or the memory-mapped interface to the GIC CPU interface is used for EL2.

bitField.name: Enable
bitField.description: Enable. Enables lower Exception level access to ICC_SRE.

register.name: ICH_HCR
register.description: Controls the environment for Guest operating systems.

bitField.name: EOIcount
bitField.description: Counts the number of EOIs received that do not have a corresponding entry in the List registers. The virtual CPU interface increments this field automatically when a matching EOI is received.

bitField.name: TSEI
bitField.description: Trap all locally generated SEIs. This bit allows the hypervisor to intercept locally generated SEIs that would otherwise be taken at Non-secure EL1.

bitField.name: TALL1
bitField.description: Trap all Non-secure EL1 accesses to ICC_* System registers for Group 1 interrupts to EL2.

bitField.name: TALL0
bitField.description: Trap all Non-secure EL1 accesses to ICC_* System registers for Group 0 interrupts to EL2.

bitField.name: TC
bitField.description: Trap all Non-secure EL1 accesses to System registers that are common to Group 0 and Group 1 to EL2.

bitField.name: LRENPIE
bitField.description: List Register Entry Not Present Interrupt Enable.

register.name: ICH_LRC0
register.description: Provides interrupt context information for the virtual CPU interface.

bitField.name: HW
bitField.description: Indicates whether this virtual interrupt maps directly to a hardware interrupt, meaning that it corresponds to a physical interrupt. Deactivation of the virtual interrupt also causes the deactivation of the physical interrupt with the ID that the pINTID field indicates.

bitField.name: Group
bitField.description: Indicates the group for this virtual interrupt.

bitField.name: pINTID
bitField.description: Physical interrupt ID, for hardware interrupts.

register.name: ICH_MISR
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Maintenance Interrupt State Register
register.description: Indicates which maintenance interrupts are asserted.

register.name: ICH_VMCR
register.gui_name: Interrupt Controller Virtual Machine Control Register
register.description: Enables the hypervisor to save and restore the virtual machine view of the GIC state.

bitField.name: VPMR
bitField.description: Virtual Priority Mask. The priority mask level for the virtual CPU interface. If the priority of a pending virtual interrupt is higher than the value indicated by this field, the interface signals the virtual interrupt to the PE.

bitField.name: VBPR0
bitField.description: Virtual Binary Point Register, Group 0. Defines the point at which the priority value fields split into two parts, the group priority field and the subpriority field. The group priority field determines Group 0 interrupt preemption, and also determines Group 1 interrupt preemption if ICH_VMCR.VCBPR == 1.

bitField.name: VBPR1
bitField.description: Virtual Binary Point Register, Group 1. Defines the point at which the priority value fields split into two parts, the group priority field and the subpriority field. The group priority field determines Group 1 interrupt preemption if ICH_VMCR.VCBPR == 0.

register.name: ICH_VTR
register.description: Describes the number of implemented virtual priority bits and List registers.

bitField.name: PRIbits
bitField.description: The number of virtual priority bits implemented, minus one.

bitField.name: PREbits
bitField.description: The number of virtual preemption bits implemented, minus one.

bitField.name: IDbits
bitField.description: The number of virtual interrupt identifier bits supported:

bitField.name: nV4
bitField.description: GICv4 direct injection of virtual interrupts not supported.

bitField.name: ListRegs
bitField.description: The number of implemented List registers, minus one. For example, a value of 0b01111 indicates that the maximum of 16 List registers are implemented.

register.name: TLBIALLH
register.description: Invalidate all TLB entries for the PL2 translation regime.

register.name: TLBIALLHIS
register.gui_name: TLB Invalidate All, Hyp mode, Inner Shareable
register.description: Invalidate all TLB entries for the PL2 translation regime, on all PEs in the same Inner Shareable domain.

register.name: TLBIIPAS2
register.gui_name: TLB Invalidate by Intermediate Physical Address, Stage 2
register.description: Invalidate TLB entries for stage 2 of the Non-secure PL1&0 translation regime that match the given IPA and the current VMID.

bitField.name: IPA_39_12
bitField.description: Bits[39:12] of the intermediate physical address to match.

register.name: TLBIIPAS2IS
register.gui_name: TLB Invalidate by Intermediate Physical Address, Stage 2, Inner Shareable
register.description: Invalidate TLB entries for stage 2 of the Non-secure PL1&0 translation regime that match the given IPA and the current VMID, on all PEs in the same Inner Shareable domain.

bitField.name: IPA_39_12
bitField.description: Bits[39:12] of the intermediate physical address to match.

register.name: TLBIIPAS2L
register.gui_name: TLB Invalidate by Intermediate Physical Address, Stage 2, Last level
register.description: Invalidate TLB entries for stage 2 of the Non-secure PL1&0 translation regime, for the last level of translation, that match the given IPA and the current VMID.

bitField.name: IPA_39_12
bitField.description: Bits[39:12] of the intermediate physical address to match.

register.name: TLBIIPAS2LIS
register.gui_name: TLB Invalidate by Intermediate Physical Address, Stage 2, Last level, Inner Shareable
register.description: Invalidate TLB entries for stage 2 of the Non-secure PL1&0 translation regime, for the last level of translation, that match the given IPA and the current VMID, on all PEs in the same Inner Shareable domain.

bitField.name: IPA_39_12
bitField.description: Bits[39:12] of the intermediate physical address to match.

register.name: TLBIMVAH
register.gui_name: TLB Invalidate by VA, Hyp mode
register.description: Invalidate TLB entries for the Non-secure PL2 translation regime that match the given VA.

bitField.name: VA
bitField.description: Virtual address to match. Any TLB entries that match the ASID value and VA value will be affected by this operation.

register.name: TLBIMVAHIS
register.gui_name: TLB Invalidate by VA, Hyp mode, Inner Shareable
register.description: Invalidate TLB entries for the Non-secure PL2 translation regime that match the given VA, on all PEs in the same Inner Shareable domain.

bitField.name: VA
bitField.description: Virtual address to match. Any TLB entries that match the ASID value and VA value will be affected by this operation.

register.name: TLBIMVALH
register.gui_name: TLB Invalidate by VA, Last level, Hyp mode
register.description: Invalidate TLB entries for the Non-secure PL2 translation regime, for the last level of translation, that match the given VA.

bitField.name: VA
bitField.description: Virtual address to match. Any TLB entries that match the ASID value and VA value will be affected by this operation.

register.name: TLBIMVALHIS
register.gui_name: TLB Invalidate by VA, Last level, Hyp mode, Inner Shareable
register.description: Invalidate TLB entries for the Non-secure PL2 translation regime, for the last level of translation, that match the given VA, on all PEs in the same Inner Shareable domain.

bitField.name: VA
bitField.description: Virtual address to match. Any TLB entries that match the ASID value and VA value will be affected by this operation.

register.name: VMPIDR
register.description: Holds the value of the Virtualization Multiprocessor ID. This is the value returned by Non-secure EL1 reads of MPIDR.

bitField.name: M
bitField.description: Indicates whether this implementation includes the functionality introduced by the ARMv7 Multiprocessing Extensions.

bitField.name: U
bitField.description: Indicates a Uniprocessor system, as distinct from PE 0 in a multiprocessor system.

bitField.name: MT
bitField.description: Indicates whether the lowest level of affinity consists of logical PEs that are implemented using a multi-threading type approach.

bitField.name: Aff2
bitField.description: Affinity level 2. The least significant affinity level field, for this PE in the system.

bitField.name: Aff1
bitField.description: Affinity level 1. The intermediate affinity level field, for this PE in the system.

bitField.name: Aff0
bitField.description: Affinity level 0. The most significant affinity level field, for this PE in the system.

register.name: VPIDR
register.description: Holds the value of the Virtualization Processor ID. This is the value returned by Non-secure EL1 reads of MIDR.

bitField.name: Implementer
bitField.description: The Implementer code. This field must hold an implementer code that has been assigned by ARM.

bitField.name: Variant
bitField.description: An IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED variant number. Typically, this field is used to distinguish between different product variants, or major revisions of a product.

bitField.name: Architecture
bitField.description: The permitted values of this field are:

bitField.name: PartNum
bitField.description: An IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED primary part number for the device.

bitField.name: Revision
bitField.description: An IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED revision number for the device.

register.name: VTCR
register.description: Controls the translation table walks required for the stage 2 translation of memory accesses from Non-secure modes other than Hyp mode, and holds cacheability and shareability information for the accesses.

bitField.name: SH0
bitField.description: Shareability attribute for memory associated with translation table walks using VTTBR.

bitField.name: ORGN0
bitField.description: Outer cacheability attribute for memory associated with translation table walks using VTTBR.

bitField.name: IRGN0
bitField.description: Inner cacheability attribute for memory associated with translation table walks using VTTBR.

bitField.name: SL0
bitField.description: Starting level for translation table walks using VTTBR.

bitField.name: S
bitField.description: Sign extension bit. This bit must be programmed to the value of T0SZ[3]. If it is not, then the stage 2 T0SZ value is treated as an UNKNOWN value.

bitField.name: T0SZ
bitField.description: The size offset of the memory region addressed by VTTBR. The region size is 2^(32-T0SZ) bytes.

register.name: VTTBR
register.description: Holds the base address of the translation table for the stage 2 translation of memory accesses from Non-secure modes other than Hyp mode.

bitField.name: VMID
bitField.description: The VMID for the translation table.

bitField.name: BADDR
bitField.description: Translation table base address, bits[47:x], Bits [x-1:0] are RES0, with the additional requirement that if bits[x-1:3] are not all zero, this is a misaligned Translation Table Base Address, with effects that are CONSTRAINED UNPREDICTABLE, and must be one of the following:

tcf:enumItem.description: A 0 to 1 transition of the trigger bit triggers an event.
tcf:enumItem.name: A_0_to_1_transition_of_the_trigger_bit_triggers_an_event

tcf:enumItem.description: A 1 to 0 transition of the trigger bit triggers an event.
tcf:enumItem.name: A_1_to_0_transition_of_the_trigger_bit_triggers_an_event

tcf:enumItem.description: Disables the event stream.
tcf:enumItem.name: Disables_the_event_stream

tcf:enumItem.description: Enables the event stream.
tcf:enumItem.name: Enables_the_event_stream

tcf:enumItem.name: Non_secure_PL0_and_PL1_accesses_to_the_CNTPCT_are_not_trapped_to_Hyp_mode

tcf:enumItem.name: Non_secure_PL1_accesses_to_the_CPACR_are_not_trapped_to_Hyp_mode

tcf:enumItem.description: Non-secure PL1 accesses to the CPACR are trapped to Hyp mode.
tcf:enumItem.name: Non_secure_PL1_accesses_to_the_CPACR_are_trapped_to_Hyp_mode

tcf:enumItem.description: Non-secure CP14 register accesses to all implemented trace registers are not trapped to Hyp mode.
tcf:enumItem.name: Non_secure_CP14_register_accesses_to_all_implemented_trace_registers_are_not_trapped_to_Hyp_mode

tcf:enumItem.description: Any attempt at PL2, or Non-secure PL0 or PL1, to execute a CP14 register access to any implemented trace register is trapped to Hyp mode. Trapped instructions generate:
tcf:enumItem.name: Any_attempt_at_PL2_or_Non_secure_PL0_or_PL1_to_execute_a_CP14_register_access_to_any_implemented_trace_register_is_trapped_to_Hyp_mode

tcf:enumItem.description: Non-secure execution of Advanced SIMD instructions is not trapped to Hyp mode.
tcf:enumItem.name: Non_secure_execution_of_Advanced_SIMD_instructions_is_not_trapped_to_Hyp_mode

tcf:enumItem.description: Any attempt to execute an Advanced SIMD instruction at PL2, or at Non-secure PL0 or PL1, is trapped to Hyp mode. Trapped instructions generate:
tcf:enumItem.name: Any_attempt_to_execute_an_Advanced_SIMD_instruction_at_PL2_or_at_Non_secure_PL0_or_PL1_is_trapped_to_Hyp_mode

tcf:enumItem.description: Has no effect on access coprocessor <n> from Non-secure PL2, PL1 and PL0 modes. Hyp mode can access coprocessor <n> regardless of the value of CPACR.cp<n>.
tcf:enumItem.name: Has_no_effect_on_access_coprocessor_n_from_Non_secure_PL2_PL1_and_PL0_modes

tcf:enumItem.description: Non-secure PL0 and PL1 accesses to coprocessor <n> are trapped to Hyp mode, and PL2 accesses to coprocessor <n> are UNDEFINED.
tcf:enumItem.name: Non_secure_PL0_and_PL1_accesses_to_coprocessor_n_are_trapped_to_Hyp_mode_and_PL2_accesses_to_coprocessor_n_are_UNDEFINED

tcf:enumItem.description: Non-secure PL1 read accesses to Virtual Memory controls are not trapped to Hyp mode.
tcf:enumItem.name: Non_secure_PL1_read_accesses_to_Virtual_Memory_controls_are_not_trapped_to_Hyp_mode

tcf:enumItem.description: Non-secure PL1 read accesses to Virtual Memory controls are trapped to Hyp mode.
tcf:enumItem.name: Non_secure_PL1_read_accesses_to_Virtual_Memory_controls_are_trapped_to_Hyp_mode

tcf:enumItem.description: HVC instruction execution is enabled at PL2 and Non-secure PL1.
tcf:enumItem.name: HVC_instruction_execution_is_enabled_at_PL2_and_Non_secure_PL1

tcf:enumItem.description: HVC instructions are UNDEFINED at PL2 and Non-secure PL1. The Undefined Instruction exception is taken from the current Exception level to the current Exception level.
tcf:enumItem.name: HVC_instructions_are_UNDEFINED_at_PL2_and_Non_secure_PL1

tcf:enumItem.description: Non-secure PL1 write accesses to EL1 virtual memory control registers are not trapped to Hyp mode.

tcf:enumItem.description: Non-secure PL1 accesses to TLB maintenance instructions are not trapped to Hyp mode.

tcf:enumItem.name: Non_secure_PL1_accesses_to_the_ICIMVAU_ICIALLU_ICIALLUIS_and_DCCMVAU_instructions_are_not_trapped_to_Hyp_mode

tcf:enumItem.description: Non-secure PL1 accesses to the DCIMVAC, DCCIMVAC, and DCCMVAC instructions are not trapped to Hyp mode.
tcf:enumItem.name: Non_secure_PL1_accesses_to_the_DCIMVAC_DCCIMVAC_and_DCCMVAC_instructions_are_not_trapped_to_Hyp_mode

tcf:enumItem.description: Non-secure PL1 accesses to the DCIMVAC, DCCIMVAC, and DCCMVAC instructions are trapped to Hyp mode.
tcf:enumItem.name: Non_secure_PL1_accesses_to_the_DCIMVAC_DCCIMVAC_and_DCCMVAC_instructions_are_trapped_to_Hyp_mode

tcf:enumItem.description: Non-secure PL1 accesses to the DCISW, DCCSW, and DCCISW instructions are not trapped to Hyp mode.
tcf:enumItem.name: Non_secure_PL1_accesses_to_the_DCISW_DCCSW_and_DCCISW_instructions_are_not_trapped_to_Hyp_mode

tcf:enumItem.name: Non_secure_PL1_accesses_to_the_DCISW_DCCSW_and_DCCISW_instructions_are_trapped_to_Hyp_mode

tcf:enumItem.description: Non-secure PL1 accesses to the Auxiliary Control Registers are not trapped to Hyp mode.
tcf:enumItem.name: Non_secure_PL1_accesses_to_the_Auxiliary_Control_Registers_are_not_trapped_to_Hyp_mode

tcf:enumItem.description: Non-secure PL1 accesses to the ACTLR and, if implemented, the ACTLR2, are trapped to Hyp mode.
tcf:enumItem.name: Non_secure_PL1_accesses_to_the_ACTLR_and_if_implemented_the_ACTLR2_are_trapped_to_Hyp_mode

tcf:enumItem.description: Any attempt to execute an SMC instruction at Non-secure PL1 is trapped to Hyp mode, regardless of the value of SCR.SCD.
tcf:enumItem.name: Any_attempt_to_execute_an_SMC_instruction_at_Non_secure_PL1_is_trapped_to_Hyp_mode_regardless_of_the_value_of_SCR

tcf:enumItem.description: Non-secure PL1 read accesses to ID Group 3 are not trapped to Hyp mode. Non-secure PL1 read accesses to the ID_MMFR4 register are not trapped to Hyp mode.
tcf:enumItem.name: Non_secure_PL1_read_accesses_to_ID_Group_3_are_not_trapped_to_Hyp_mode

tcf:enumItem.description: Non-secure PL1 read accesses to ID Group 3 are trapped to Hyp mode. Non-secure PL1 read accesses to the ID_MMFR4 register are trapped to Hyp mode, if this register contains a non-zero value.
tcf:enumItem.name: Non_secure_PL1_read_accesses_to_ID_Group_3_are_trapped_to_Hyp_mode

tcf:enumItem.description: Non-secure PL0 and PL1 read accesses to the CTR, CCSIDR, and CLIDR registers are not trapped to Hyp mode. Non-secure PL0 and PL1 accesses to the CSSELR register are not trapped to Hyp mode.
tcf:enumItem.name: Non_secure_PL0_and_PL1_read_accesses_to_the_CTR_CCSIDR_and_CLIDR_registers_are_not_trapped_to_Hyp_mode

tcf:enumItem.description: Non-secure PL0 and PL1 read accesses to the CTR, CCSIDR, and CLIDR registers are trapped to Hyp mode. Non-secure PL0 and PL1 accesses to the CSSELR register are trapped to Hyp mode.
tcf:enumItem.name: Non_secure_PL0_and_PL1_read_accesses_to_the_CTR_CCSIDR_and_CLIDR_registers_are_trapped_to_Hyp_mode

tcf:enumItem.description: Non-secure PL1 read accesses to the TCMTR, TLBTR, REVIDR, and AIDR registers are not trapped to Hyp mode.
tcf:enumItem.name: Non_secure_PL1_read_accesses_to_the_TCMTR_TLBTR_REVIDR_and_AIDR_registers_are_not_trapped_to_Hyp_mode

tcf:enumItem.description: Non-secure PL1 read accesses to the TCMTR, TLBTR, REVIDR, and AIDR registers are trapped to Hyp mode.

tcf:enumItem.description: Any attempt at PL2 to execute any of the following is UNDEFINED: These instructions are always UNDEFINED, regardless of whether they would pass or fail the condition code check that applies to them as a result of being in an IT block. It is IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED whether the IT instruction is treated as: This means that, for the situations that are UNDEFINED, either the second 16-bit instruction or the 32-bit instruction is UNDEFINED. An implementation might vary dynamically as to whether IT is treated as a 16-bit instruction or the first half of a 32-bit instruction.
tcf:enumItem.name: Any_attempt_at_PL2_to_execute_any_of_the_following_is_UNDEFINED_These_instructions_are_always_UNDEFINED_regardless_of_whether_they_would_pass_or_fail_the_condition_code_check_that_applies_to_them_as_a_result_of_being_in_an_IT_block

tcf:enumItem.description: Alignment fault checking disabled when executing at EL2. Instructions that load or store one or more registers, other than load/store exclusive and load-acquire/store-release, do not check that the address being accessed is aligned to the size of the data element(s) being accessed.
tcf:enumItem.name: Alignment_fault_checking_disabled_when_executing_at_EL2

tcf:enumItem.description: Alignment fault checking enabled when executing at EL2. All instructions that load or store one or more registers have an alignment check that the address being accessed is aligned to the size of the data element(s) being accessed. If this check fails it causes an Alignment fault, which is taken as a Data Abort exception.
tcf:enumItem.name: Alignment_fault_checking_enabled_when_executing_at_EL2

tcf:enumItem.description: Virtual CPU interface operation enabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: Virtual_CPU_interface_operation_enabled

tcf:enumItem.description: Pending and active.
tcf:enumItem.name: Pending_and_active

tcf:enumItem.description: The interrupt is triggered entirely by software. No notification is sent to the Distributor when the virtual interrupt is deactivated.
tcf:enumItem.name: The_interrupt_is_triggered_entirely_by_software

tcf:enumItem.description: The interrupt maps directly to a hardware interrupt. A deactivate interrupt request is sent to the Distributor when the virtual interrupt is deactivated, using the pINTID field from this register to indicate the physical interrupt ID. If ICH_VMCR.VEOIM is 0, this request corresponds to a write to ICC_EOIR0 or ICC_EOIR1. Otherwise, it corresponds to a write to ICC_DIR.
tcf:enumItem.name: The_interrupt_maps_directly_to_a_hardware_interrupt

tcf:enumItem.description: This is a Group 0 virtual interrupt. ICH_VMCR.VFIQEn determines whether it is signaled as a virtual IRQ or as a virtual FIQ, and ICH_VMCR.VENG0 enables signaling of this interrupt to the virtual machine.
tcf:enumItem.name: This_is_a_Group_0_virtual_interrupt

tcf:enumItem.description: This is a Group 1 virtual interrupt, signaled as a virtual IRQ. ICH_VMCR.VENG1 enables the signaling of this interrupt to the virtual machine. If ICH_VMCR.VCBPR is 0, then ICC_BPR1 determines if a pending Group 1 interrupt has sufficient priority to preempt current execution. Otherwise, ICC_BPR0 determines preemption.
tcf:enumItem.name: This_is_a_Group_1_virtual_interrupt_signaled_as_a_virtual_IRQ

tcf:enumItem.description: VM Group 1 Disabled maintenance interrupt not asserted.
tcf:enumItem.name: VM_Group_1_Disabled_maintenance_interrupt_not_asserted

tcf:enumItem.description: VM Group 1 Disabled maintenance interrupt asserted.
tcf:enumItem.name: VM_Group_1_Disabled_maintenance_interrupt_asserted

tcf:enumItem.name: VM_Group_0_Enabled_maintenance_interrupt_asserted

tcf:enumItem.name: No_Pending_maintenance_interrupt_not_asserted

tcf:enumItem.name: No_Pending_maintenance_interrupt_asserted

tcf:enumItem.name: List_Register_Entry_Not_Present_maintenance_interrupt_asserted

tcf:enumItem.description: Underflow maintenance interrupt asserted.
tcf:enumItem.name: Underflow_maintenance_interrupt_asserted

tcf:enumItem.description: End Of Interrupt maintenance interrupt not asserted.
tcf:enumItem.name: End_Of_Interrupt_maintenance_interrupt_not_asserted

tcf:enumItem.description: End Of Interrupt maintenance interrupt asserted.
tcf:enumItem.name: End_Of_Interrupt_maintenance_interrupt_asserted

tcf:enumItem.description: A write of an INTID to ICC_EOIR0 or ICC_EOIR1 drops the priority of the interrupt with that INTID, and also deactivates that interrupt.
tcf:enumItem.name: A_write_of_an_INTID_to_ICC_EOIR0_or_ICC_EOIR1_drops_the_priority_of_the_interrupt_with_that_INTID_and_also_deactivates_that_interrupt

tcf:enumItem.description: A write of an INTID to ICC_EOIR0 or ICC_EOIR1 only drops the priority of the interrupt with that INTID. Software must write to ICC_DIR to deactivate the interrupt.
tcf:enumItem.name: A_write_of_an_INTID_to_ICC_EOIR0_or_ICC_EOIR1_only_drops_the_priority_of_the_interrupt_with_that_INTID

tcf:enumItem.description: ICC_BPR1 determines the preemption group for Non-secure Group 1 interrupts.
tcf:enumItem.name: ICC_BPR1_determines_the_preemption_group_for_Non_secure_Group_1_interrupts

tcf:enumItem.description: ICC_BPR0 determines the preemption group for Non-secure Group 1 interrupts. Non-secure accesses to GICC_BPR and ICC_BPR1 access the state of ICC_BPR0.
tcf:enumItem.name: ICC_BPR0_determines_the_preemption_group_for_Non_secure_Group_1_interrupts

tcf:enumItem.description: Group 0 virtual interrupts are presented as virtual IRQs.
tcf:enumItem.name: Group_0_virtual_interrupts_are_presented_as_virtual_IRQs

tcf:enumItem.description: Group 0 virtual interrupts are presented as virtual FIQs.
tcf:enumItem.name: Group_0_virtual_interrupts_are_presented_as_virtual_FIQs

tcf:enumItem.description: If the highest priority pending interrupt is Group 1, a read of GICV_IAR or GICV_HPPIR returns an interrupt ID of 1022.
tcf:enumItem.name: If_the_highest_priority_pending_interrupt_is_Group_1_a_read_of_GICV_IAR_or_GICV_HPPIR_returns_an_interrupt_ID_of_1022

tcf:enumItem.description: If the highest priority pending interrupt is Group 1, a read of GICV_IAR or GICV_HPPIR returns the interrupt ID of the corresponding interrupt.
tcf:enumItem.name: If_the_highest_priority_pending_interrupt_is_Group_1_a_read_of_GICV_IAR_or_GICV_HPPIR_returns_the_interrupt_ID_of_the_corresponding_interrupt
